result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah M. Degenhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Conspire to Manufacture/Deliver Drugs], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or combination of education and employment equivalent to being occupied full time and employment must be in an occupation acceptable to agent; not voluntarily quit employment without agent approval.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and programming recommended.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medication exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

Obey all rules and conditions established by agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

NO SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain full time employment that meets with agent's approval and not voluntarily quit employment without agent's approval.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Submit to any assessments, conditions and treatment programs agent deems necessary.

Obtain housing that is acceptable to agent.

No contact with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Obey all no contact orders per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
